New California Poll:

Latinos want CA to do more to fight pollution, climate change in Latino communities.

Results here

The survey confirms that Latinos not only want the state of California to address global warming, climate change and air pollution, but they also expect want more aggressive action to invest in locally targeted renewable energy sources rather than fossil fuels. They also would be much more inclined to support a legislator who backs legislation to curb fossil fuel use.

But when asked about how to address the problem, Latino voters respond more enthusiastically to environmental protection strategies that are specifically devoted to targeting most impacted communities, particularly Hispanic and other communities of color.

  • 87 percent of Latinos somewhat to strongly agree that we need to increase investment in clean public transportation in our communities to decrease the amount of cars on the roads and 75% support the state to provideing financial assistance forincentives for to low income families in buying low emission carsdrives.

  • 87 percent of Latinos say they would like to see more “Green Jobs” in the Latino community.

  • 81 percent of Latinos somewhat to strongly agree that our state government should devote more resources to address environmental issues and pollution in Black and Latino communities.

  • 89 percent of Latinos somewhat to strongly agree that if the state invests money to develop new technology for renewable energy and pollution control, we need to make sure those investments go equally into the Latino community.

Download full report results.
